Ranking below #1 for 2 keywords - increase customer reviews and engagement to improve rankings

reviews.text: I've been curious to try this Italian restaurant as I drive past it every day, and it did not disappoint! The vibe was chill and cozy. The wine list is great. We started with the calamari, which was well seasoned and breaded. I had the veal marsala with the daily soup. The daily soup was average. The veal marsala, however, was amazing. The sauce it comes with is delicious. My husband chose the clam linguini with the salad, which was good. The clam was quite tasty. For dessert, we had the chocobella cake, but unfortunately, it was also just average. I'm not sure if the chocolate cake is made in-house or bought from somewhere else, but for $10, I was expecting the cake to be better. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and know what to get again next time we visit and what to stay away from.

Always Worth the Drive ‚Äî Comforting, Classic Italian with Heart

Fratelli Italian Food has been one of my go-to spots for years‚Äîand it never disappoints. Whether it‚Äôs date night, dinner with friends, or a bigger group outing, this place consistently delivers delicious food, warm service, and that homey, family-run charm that‚Äôs getting harder to find.

I always recommend calling ahead for a reservation, especially if you‚Äôre rolling in with more than two people. They‚Äôve got plenty of room for larger groups (huge plus!), but I like the peace of mind knowing we‚Äôve got a table waiting.

We tend to start every meal the same way‚Äîwith their antipasto board, and honestly, why mess with perfection? It‚Äôs a beautiful spread of deli meats, cheeses, olives, sweet peppers, and this time, perfectly cooked asparagus. It‚Äôs shareable, satisfying, and the kind of appetizer that feels like an occasion in itself.

Entrees come with a salad, and the house-made feta dressing is always our pick. Creamy, tangy, and addictive‚Äîit‚Äôs reason enough to clean your plate.

For my main dish, I went with the chicken piccata, and it was a win: tender, bright with lemon, and generously portioned. Between the caper-forward sauce and the size of the plate, it was a win for both my appetite and leftovers the next day. My other half ordered the veal marsala, which is rich and satisfying‚Äîjust know it leans a bit sweet. Our friend went with the spaghetti and meatballs, which feels like Fratelli‚Äôs unofficial signature dish. Always classic, always comforting.

Their wine list leans Italian, of course, and it‚Äôs well-curated‚Äîplenty of great options by the glass or bottle. I only managed a couple photos this time because, full honesty‚Ä¶ I was way too excited to eat. Fratelli is a bit of a drive from home, and when you‚Äôre craving comforting Italian in a space that feels like family‚Äîyou make the trip.

Looking for that mom-and-pop magic with consistently good food, generous portions, and a welcoming vibe? This is your spot.

I have dined here several times. And each time is amazing! Today I had the lobster ravioli. So so good! Last time I had the beef braised ravioli which was equally as good. Salads are delicious. Service is perfect !

Arrived at 8:45pm with posted closure at 9pm. Planned to order take-out of whatever was left & easy, but doors were locked & lights were off upon arrival.

Employee inside did not acknowledge or come over to explain, nor was there a sign on the door saying they close earlier than posted times when empty. Disappointed & not sure we'll bother again anytime soon with so many other local options nearby.

That's fine to close early but have the courtesy to man the door & explain to patrons at the minimum.

Good food and service. Food has always been consistent. Nothing here stands out but enjoyable experience all the same. They need to learn how to make a ceasar salad....spring mix is not part of it. Disappointed they change the dressing on the same spring mix and call it a different salad.

editorial_summary.overview: Contemporary bistro & on-site deli serving traditional Italian dishes made from family recipes.

issues: Mobile performance data unavailable - API configuration required
recommendations: Configure Google PageSpeed Insights API for mobile analysis
Test website on mobile devices manually

recentReviews.text: The Absolute best tomato Bisque soup ever ... and the spaghetti sauce is the Absolute best.. most definitely eating there again.. the Wait staff was the best .God Bless Y'alls. Prayers Huggs and Love Always ‚úÖÔ∏è
This Italian quickly became my favorite. Locally owned by 2 brothers their wood-fired pizzas are amazing, their italian nachos are a masterpiece.
This was the best place i‚Äôve ever been! I‚Äôd eat here every single day!
Way overpriced for amount and taste.   Not worth it.
Food was exceptionally mid, but the service and atmosphere were both amazing.
Great family dinner with good options for everyone.  All the food looked great and I want to try their lunch sandwich menu!

Looking for that mom-and-pop magic with consistently good food, generous portions, and a welcoming vibe? This is your spot.
Very mediocre, bland, overpriced Italian food. Tomato basil soup was the only redeeming quality.

detailedReviews.author: Steven Jennings
detailedReviews.text: The Absolute best tomato Bisque soup ever ... and the spaghetti sauce is the Absolute best.. most definitely eating there again.. the Wait staff was the best .God Bless Y'alls. Prayers Huggs and Love Always ‚úÖÔ∏è

detailedReviews.author: Kimberly Hinkins-Herd
detailedReviews.text: This Italian quickly became my favorite. Locally owned by 2 brothers their wood-fired pizzas are amazing, their italian nachos are a masterpiece.

detailedReviews.author: Owen Martin
detailedReviews.text: This was the best place i‚Äôve ever been! I‚Äôd eat here every single day!

detailedReviews.author: Joyce Steverson
detailedReviews.text: Way overpriced for amount and taste.   Not worth it.

detailedReviews.author: Thomas Pointon
detailedReviews.text: Food was exceptionally mid, but the service and atmosphere were both amazing.

detailedReviews.author: Parker Checketts
detailedReviews.text: Great family dinner with good options for everyone.  All the food looked great and I want to try their lunch sandwich menu!

detailedReviews.author: Kimo Kahookele
detailedReviews.text:
Always Worth the Drive ‚Äî Comforting, Classic Italian with Heart

Fratelli Italian Food has been one of my go-to spots for years‚Äîand it never disappoints. Whether it‚Äôs date night, dinner with friends, or a bigger group outing, this place consistently delivers delicious food, warm service, and that homey, family-run charm that‚Äôs getting harder to find.

detailedReviews.author: Joe Peterson
detailedReviews.text: Very mediocre, bland, overpriced Italian food. Tomato basil soup was the only redeeming quality.

detailedReviews.author: Kacee Woolsey
detailedReviews.text: This was our first time trying this restaurant. It was good, but not great.  For a Friday night, we expected it to be very busy but there was hardly any people there at all. The food was decent and the service was good. I wouldn‚Äôt be opposed to going back but it wouldn‚Äôt be my first choice.

detailedReviews.author: Corinne Evenson
detailedReviews.text: The nachos and Fratelli pizza was delicious! Staff was friendly and helpful. The Arancini was okay, but the pesto was fantastic.

detailedReviews.author: Estefany L.
detailedReviews.text: I've been curious to try this Italian restaurant as I drive past it every day, and it did not disappoint! The vibe was chill and cozy. The wine list is great. We started with the calamari, which was well seasoned and breaded. I had the veal marsala with the daily soup. The daily soup was average. The veal marsala, however, was amazing. The sauce it comes with is delicious. My husband chose the clam linguini with the salad, which was good. The clam was quite tasty. For dessert, we had the chocobella cake, but unfortunately, it was also just average. I'm not sure if the chocolate cake is made in-house or bought from somewhere else, but for $10, I was expecting the cake to be better. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and know what to get again next time we visit and what to stay away from.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Bullock
detailedReviews.text: This is a great spot to stop in Sandy. The food is incredible. They have fantastic salads, soups, pizza and of course main course dishes. The staff is incredibly friendly and the atmosphere is well put together. Very relaxing spot for either a lunch stop or a date night out. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Rosie Santiago
detailedReviews.text: I got the clam linguine. It was very salty not flavorful at all.

detailedReviews.author: Diane Harvey
detailedReviews.text: The reviews sound like they are describing another restaurant. This was the worst place I have been to in many years. I had a horrible salad. Like a pound of spinach with some nasty chicken on it. There was supposed to be pears and gorgonzola. I couldn't find any, just some chopped apples. The dressing tasted like puke. $17.! I just picked at it as it was making me sick. My friend had eggplant which was equally bad, cold, and extremely overpriced.

detailedReviews.author: Heidi & Qtip
detailedReviews.text:
Arrived at 8:45pm with posted closure at 9pm. Planned to order take-out of whatever was left & easy, but doors were locked & lights were off upon arrival.

Employee inside did not acknowledge or come over to explain, nor was there a sign on the door saying they close earlier than posted times when empty. Disappointed & not sure we'll bother again anytime soon with so many other local options nearby.

That's fine to close early but have the courtesy to man the door & explain to patrons at the minimum.

detailedReviews.author: Annie P
detailedReviews.text: I have dined here several times. And each time is amazing! Today I had the lobster ravioli. So so good! Last time I had the beef braised ravioli which was equally as good. Salads are delicious. Service is perfect !

detailedReviews.author: Jonni Bonnet
detailedReviews.text:
First off, service is excellent. Our waitress was so sweet and continued to fill water cups after we paid and were just sitting and talking.
Food was okay....I did enjoy the freshly made bread and the coffee was excellent!  Everything else was a little middle of the road. Not mad about it but no raving about it

detailedReviews.author: Jennifer
detailedReviews.text:
We were in Sandy and decided to try something new. I am glad we did. The food was amazing! We both got the Lobster ü¶û ravioli, with Vodka tomato cream sauce with garlic shrimp.
We also got the soup of the day, which was Cajun cream chicken, and that was also delicious. The waitress was very nice and very attentive, same with the hostess. The atmosphere was very pleasant. The music was Italian, which you don't normally hear. If you're out in Sandy, I suggest you try it

detailedReviews.author: Dawn Orn
detailedReviews.text:
We are making this our go Italian restaurant!
The food is great  service is quick, and they have a great selection of wine, and 1st rate cocktails!
My loves the strawberry lemonade,  and I'm a sucker for the halibut picatta.
Go you won't regret it

detailedReviews.author: Mark Newey
detailedReviews.text: Went for lunch with my wife. We can't eat a lot, so we shared the meatball sandwich and it was awesome. Their bread was freshly baked and tasted very good.

detailedReviews.author: Gina Edwards
detailedReviews.text: This was the best meal I've had since moving to Utah. Coming from NYC, I missed authentic, fresh Italian cuisines.  This was all that and more. And, with exceptional service, I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. We'll be back for sure!

detailedReviews.author: Sherry LaRue
detailedReviews.text: My family and I had a wonderful time here tonight. The food was delicious and great presentation. Our waitress Tina was wonderful.

detailedReviews.author: Looking To Get Lost
detailedReviews.text: Good food and service. Food has always been consistent. Nothing here stands out but enjoyable experience all the same. They need to learn how to make a ceasar salad....spring mix is not part of it. Disappointed they change the dressing on the same spring mix and call it a different salad.

detailedReviews.author: Clayton Dumas
detailedReviews.text: Delicious Italian food...

detailedReviews.author: CB 3
detailedReviews.text: Loved the food and service here!!

detailedReviews.author: Scot P
detailedReviews.text: I'm a huge connoisseur of alfredo sauce. I ordered Alfredo entries very opportunity I have. All over the state of Utah, the country in a few places in the world. Unfortunately, I've never been to Italy, but it's on my list. Mainly to try Alfredo in Italy üáÆüáπ. For my taste. This was the 2nd best Alfredo I've ever had. #1 Battista's Hole in the Wall, Las Vegas. I'm so glad I found this place and it's less than 10 minutes from my home. I will be back again.

detailedReviews.author: Roxann Brady
detailedReviews.text: Had a birthday party. The food was great and the service was excellent

detailedReviews.author: shyanne young
detailedReviews.text: Atomosphere was great! Our waitress was named Shannon and she was so friendly and personable. She made us feel like we were so welcome and comfortable. Definitely coming back!!

detailedReviews.author: Avery Spencer
detailedReviews.text: While visiting salt lake City on vacation, we had made a reservation here after looking at their rather impressive website. We showed up on time and where seated.  We watched as the two different groups who came in behind us had their orders taken and were served food while we were still sitting there waiting for our server.  After sitting there for 20 minutes, and watching server after walk by us, we decided to leave.  We came hungry we left hungrier.  Pretty disappointed in the service or lack thereof.

detailedReviews.author: cindy mithcell
detailedReviews.text: Excellent Veal Marsala to

detailedReviews.author: Don Kleinschnitz Jr.
detailedReviews.text: Top of my list for Italian cuisine. Had the delicious tomato basil, spaghetti/meatballs and eggplant Parmesan. Service was expertly attentive. Prices were reasonable. Will return.

detailedReviews.author: Daniele D'Apuzzo
detailedReviews.text:
Mastra, in American Fork, is the real deal.
Fratelli is not authentic Italian food. Very Americanized. Let me explain why.

- carbonara needs goat cheese, not Parmesan. Which they sell! Also, there is no green peas in carbonara..
- the dirty martini cup came half full, almost half as much as any other place we have been to

The service was great, the waitress was always checking and brought everything on time.

The recipes could use some help ‚Ä¶

detailedReviews.author: Stephen Lewis
detailedReviews.text:
We like to try new places, especially to celebrate! Well last night at Fratelli‚Äôs was a disaster. We started in a great mood, was seated quickly, but there we waited. And waited. And waited. A cold apology was offered- but we ordered cocktails, appetizer and dinner all at once. The tables around us (seated after us) were seeing their wait staff, and had bread.
We were hungry too. I started looking around and another waitress (later learned was the manager) asked if we had bread. We said no, then our waitress brought bread a few mins later - again a heartless apology. But I figured- maybe she‚Äôs having a bad day. But as all the other tables seemed to be getting service, food, refills and attention- we more and more felt ignored. And hungry. And thirsty. Finally the hostess asked if we wanted more water and so we asked for our food to go, and our check.
Then more than 10 minutes later (after our waitress helped other tables) she gave another empty apology and the manager was there and said it was her daughter. I‚Äôm okay with things being, busy or slow- but don‚Äôt ignore us. Check on us , let us know it‚Äôs going to be a bit. The other tables were well taken care of - not sure what we did or didn‚Äôt do. The appetizer was pretty good and one of the two soups were good. But nothing is worth being poorly treated when all you want is to go out for a nice night.

detailedReviews.author: Patrick Utley
detailedReviews.text: Meh, it was fine. Nothing special though. Had the Carbonara, and tried the bruschetta appetizer and charcuterie board. Would offer the charcuterie again, but not the other items.

detailedReviews.author: AT
detailedReviews.text:
I made dinner reservations for myself & my parents here on Feb 12 for my mother's birthday. I had to miss dinner but my parents went and had awful experience. The staff sat them at the high bar facing the kitchen - Their backs literally to the front door. Every time someone came in from outside they were hit with cold air & noise. Not enjoyable at all.

Management: Please be considerate and DON'T take reservations if you don't have proper seating. My parents are in their 70's. Badly done.

detailedReviews.author: RB Maw
detailedReviews.text: A regular dine in and out for our family - great Italian food!

detailedReviews.author: Sadie Robirds
detailedReviews.text: Went to Fratelli's for my birthday celebration. We planned ahead for a private room. They were very gracious to put up with my big noisy family haha! Service was great and the food was delicious. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Kira Masnica
detailedReviews.text: Our 3rd visit to Fratelli, everything was exceptional! From appetizer, soup, entree to dessert off the chart fresh, bright and yummy! Shannon, you were amazing!!

detailedReviews.author: Shane Triplett
detailedReviews.text: Kinda disappointed. The house salad dressing was good and the meatballs were okay, but everything else must have been frozen and microwaved cuz those were the toughest noodles I've ever eaten. I had lasagna but you wouldn't be able to tell by looking at the plate because it looked like a bowl of marinara sauce with two meatballs in it. I prefer Stouffer's lasagna which is saying something.

detailedReviews.author: Erdem Fƒ±rat
detailedReviews.text: Our server Tina was great! Fratelli Pizza was bread more than pizza and tomato soup was like pizza sauce. But we enjoyed the time we spent there! Thank you for having us!

detailedReviews.author: Slow Walker
detailedReviews.text: Delish

detailedReviews.author: Tyler Toone
detailedReviews.text:
This is a great Italian restaurant! So many great options. Tonight I had the lasagna with sausage, and it was amazing! Service was is excellent and the ambience delightful. You've got to give this place a try. #romantic #vegetarianfriendly #datenight #healthy

1/24/25 update
The seared tuna special was one of the best dishes I‚Äôve ever had! Such a good flavor and so tender. The lemon noodles and crispy broccolini were great. My wife had the halibut and it was also very good! Savannah was an excellent server and the staff so helpful and prompt with our orders.

detailedReviews.author: Shaun Hanson
detailedReviews.text: We just had our first visit and we were blown away with the outstanding service, amazing food, and wonderful atmosphere. We will most definitely be returning on a regular basis.

detailedReviews.author: Niki Peterson
detailedReviews.text:
Fantastic food and fantastic service.
The drinks are delightful and the Gelato is absolute perfection.

detailedReviews.author: Tara Gonzales
detailedReviews.text:
Me and my family came here to celebrate my father in law's birthday. At first we were skeptical as it wasn't super busy for a Saturday night but were pleasantly surprised.

We got 3 appetizers and they were all amazing. Fresh, light, and delicious. Then we got our entrees.

Chicken parm was delicious and perfectly cooked. Lasagna was cheesy but could use a bit more spicy. Spaghetti and meatballs was classic and tasty. Fettuccine Alfredo w/ shrimp was creamy, salty, and rich. Could use a bit more shrimp.

However the carbanara was very disappointing. It lacked flavor, the sauce separated, and the panceta was overcook. It was upsetting seeing how everything else was wonderful.

Dessert was average. Tiramisu could use more lady fingers and less marscapone. The chocobella was rich but nothing special. And the vanilla gelato was creamy and the prefect amount of sweet.

The service was fantastic. Our server was attentive and friendly. Our waters were always full and drinks refilled without asking. We felt comfortable, taken care of, and enjoyed our evening.

Overall I'd say it's a great place to come and enjoy some good Italian food.

detailedReviews.author: Jenny Webster
detailedReviews.text:
Fabulous calamari
Great. fast forward, it is 2022. New beautiful building. Just as good if not  better üòâ strongly recommend!!!!   Now here we are in 2025. It's better now if that's possible!!! Sooo good!! Unfortunately it's up the street from me now. I gained 10 pounds. And totally worth it!!!üòÅ

detailedReviews.author: David Montoya
detailedReviews.text:
They hosted a high school athletic banquet banquet for my team.. They closed off the entire restaurant just for just for us. Their food was amazing and they are hospitality was even better!!  The food was great, as usual.. I highly recommend this place.
Everyone is so friendly and the food is fantastic. Desserts are the best!

If you haven't been here, you need to try it soon.

Update:
They have amazing food with good drinks and an awesome dessert menu. The employees are very nice.

detailedReviews.author: Vinod Krishnan
detailedReviews.text:
Very impressed with the spread at this wonderful Italian restaurant. Their tomato basil soup was one of the best I‚Äôve had ever.

Authentic pizza with great taste and flavor. Again the best pizza I‚Äôve had.

Ending with the Chocobella dessert which was very tasty.

Highly recommend visiting here.

detailedReviews.author: Kent Lutz
detailedReviews.text: Quite, enjoyable, tasty and top notch service!

detailedReviews.author: joe day
detailedReviews.text:
Ordered 3 pizzas the day before Thanksgiving because we didn't feel like cooking dinner. One of the pies was black and burnt on the bottom. Their oven must have been too hot, the top of the pie was not burnt. We should have taken it back, but we didnt want to drive back and deal with it and we were hungry so we ate it. The pizza is decent all in all, much better than ordering from a major nationwide pizza chain.
I will go back for sure but will inspect things before leaving if ordering take out.

detailedReviews.author: Curtis davis
detailedReviews.text: Very nice people and great food.

detailedReviews.author: Cheryl Wagner
detailedReviews.text: Dined with a large group for lunch. The food and service were good, and they accommodated us with separate checks. If you're with a group, be sure to look at your check to see if they've automatically added gratuity; they added 20% to ours without mentioning it. It makes me wonder if they're hoping people don't notice and leave an additional tip.

detailedReviews.author: Chockis Icelolly
detailedReviews.text:
Service was super slow.
Food served there was good - pizza in particular.
Our toddler was getting fuzzy so we ordered $24 worth dish - eggplant parmijan, and a $24 worth shrimp Alfredo pasta dishes , originally intended to eat at the restaurant, to be packed as take out.
We come home and the shrimp dish had exactly 4 pieces of shrimp.
The eggplant dish had no pasta - just two slices of eggplant doused in sauce and one cheese crouton.

Not worth your time or money.

detailedReviews.author: Melanie Biertzer
detailedReviews.text: I had an amazing experience at Fratelli Ristorante in Sandy! The meatball sandwich was a highlight‚Äîperfectly seasoned meatballs, smothered in rich marinara, and served on fresh, toasted bread. The warm, soft rolls were the perfect start, and their creamy tomato soup was bursting with flavor and had just the right texture. The ambiance was cozy and welcoming, making it feel like a true Italian dining experience. The service was also top-notch‚Äîfriendly and attentive without being intrusive. Fratelli nails classic Italian comfort food, and I can‚Äôt wait to come back for more!

detailedReviews.author: Toe knee Hi there
detailedReviews.text: I just happened to be on the same corner as this restaurant tonight and I have been craving some good pasta for ever it seemed. So I walk in at 8:35, 25 mins before they close and browse the menu. Now they are not to cheap of an option but well worth the cost but we'll get to that in a moment. So I ask the gentleman who was working what the serving size looked like and it wasn't as big as I had been hoping for but I settled on some Alfredo without any meat for $16 bucks. I jokingly told him to sneeze when he went to pour my pasta into the bowl so I'd get more, and said I would be back in about 5 mins to grab my order. I come back and this man makes my pasta HUGE no way that was a normal serving of pasta and slathered it's with Alfredo sauce, tells me he threw me in a piece of chicken for it being my first time trying the place and since they were about to close and he even hooked me up with 4 rolls. Now im sure most if not all that food would have ended up in the garbage since they were closing shortly however kudos to him for actually dishing it up to a customer. With  the cost of everything lately it should always be like this thank you brother, I just really hope I don't get you into trouble.

detailedReviews.author: Caesar M
detailedReviews.text: Best lasagna I have ever had!

detailedReviews.author: Blake Bishop
detailedReviews.text: Standard, middle-of-the-road Italian restaurant. We've been here a few times and haven't yet found a culinary winner on the menu. On our last visit (on a Tuesday if it matters), we ordered chicken piccata and halibut piccata. The piccata sauce had a white wine/lemon flavor but was thick and somewhat gelatinous, like it had been thickened with cornstarch or perhaps had been delivered by Sysco. It was too much like gravy. The chicken breast itself was well-prepared and flavorful. The halibut was dry. Our server also had an unfortunate but forgivable off-night owing to the large number of tables she serviced.

detailedReviews.author: Eric Jelte
detailedReviews.text: The food was on point,  and the wait staff were attentive and professional.  The decor was a little plain,  but the booths were roomy, with plenty of seats.

detailedReviews.author: Dusty Ishoy
detailedReviews.text: We have been going to Fratelli‚Äôs for 12 years. WE LOVE IT. House made delicious food at a great price. 100% Recommend

detailedReviews.author: Jeff D
detailedReviews.text: Excellent food, one of the best in the county and great service, very clean inside everyone is nice. I can't say enough good things about it. I'll be back many times. This was my first time there they were recommended to me. If you don't eat there, you're missing out.

detailedReviews.author: Trent Winn
detailedReviews.text:
Dave the owner is a baller, his service impeccable! Greeted us even shared his story of the restaurant!
Savannah our waitress was amazing some of the best service I have ever had! I would highly recommend this restaurant they know how to do it! Also the Nacho are a 10 get the nacho if you go!!

detailedReviews.author: Koby Curtis
detailedReviews.text: Food is ok. Nothing spectacular for the price and for a Italian restaurant the menu is pretty limited. The Cake desert was good but chicken parmesan was just alright.

detailedReviews.author: Dan F
detailedReviews.text: The food here was really good. The flavors weren't what you'd get at the standard Italian restaurant. It's a great addition to our regular rotation.

detailedReviews.author: Jon Warner
detailedReviews.text: Great Italian sausage Lasagna

detailedReviews.author: Dave Crane
detailedReviews.text:
We ordered the "Meatballs & Sausage" Appetizer.  I was so glad that we did!  They were seasoned and cooked perfectly.
I ordered the "Veal Marsala" and it was a tiny bit tough (that is the nature of the cut, of beef, I think) but, it was very good and the sauce was incredible!  My date ordered the Chicken Parmesan and LOVED it!  I tasted it and, I agreed!
It was so moist and delicious!  It melted in your mouth!  Cudo's to the Chef!!!!
We ordered Italian Sodas and they were THE WORST that we have ever had, ANYWHERE!   We both had a different flavor but, they tasted like carbonated water with a dash of food coloring (so weak, no flavor).  I have to believe that they were made the way that the Management tells them to them to be made(?)  Am I wrong???  For $3-$4 dollars (each) make them smaller but FULL of flavoring (like many of the other Italian eateree's that we frequent).
Our waiter made us wait just a little to long (especially for the check).  We thought that he seemed preoccupied, but busy...a lot!  [You need to do better Carter, I still gave you a 15% tip.  It wasn't that busy, yet].  We arrived at 5:30 P.M. on a Saturday.  A customer should NEVER have to wait so long that they get up, walk across the restraunt and ask a different waitress for 'to go' boxes].  And, then have to (again) wait for a check.
We will definately eat here again, I think.
Thank You

detailedReviews.author: Michelle
detailedReviews.text: By far the best Italian restaurant in Utah. Food is amazing and the service is outstanding!

detailedReviews.author: G. M.
detailedReviews.text:
Customer service was 5 star excellent.  The staff was so accommodating, kind and thoughtful of little details which can really matter. Very cute place and definitely has the feel of family owned and ownership cares about taking care of people the old fashioned way.

Food was good and satisfying.  Only tried one entr√©e; 4 star on chicken alfredo. We needed to order the same thing for a small group and it was perfect for what was needed. The deserts were delicious. We tried several and split them up for sharing.  Everyone loved that.  By the way, consider them for home party take out - pricing reasonable.

We had chicken Alfredo, salad, dessert. I would like to try some other things on the menu. If I could have given 4.5 on the food, I would have.  The choice was 4 or 5 but not allowed to show in-between.  I WILL DEFINITELY GO BACK.  Try them.

detailedReviews.author: Donna Davis
detailedReviews.text: They seated us and that was it. Fifteen minutes later we were still sitting there, with our menus, waiting for our order to be taken. Staff were standing around talking to each other. As we left an employee opened the door and said ‚ÄúHave a safe weekend,‚Äù not even realizing that we hadn‚Äôt eaten. It wasn't all that busy for a Saturday night. I gave 1 stars because I couldn‚Äôt go lower.

detailedReviews.author: Justin Cunard
detailedReviews.text: Wanted to like this place. We ordered a bottle of white wine. Wasn't chilled. Served in a bucket with barely any ice. Ordered a chicken picatta and was really disappointed. Not good at all. Chicken tasted like it was fried in oil vs butter. Clams and mussels was mediocre as well. Like other reviewers have stated, the food is bland.Overall would not recommend and won't be coming back. Not at all worth the premium price they charge for subpar food.

detailedReviews.author: Craig Niles
detailedReviews.text: The food is great!  We will be coming back for sure.   We have been looking for a good, easy, Italian place and we found it!

detailedReviews.author: Jared
detailedReviews.text: Visiting from out of town. One of my clients recommended Fratelli‚Äôs. Just squeezed in before they closed. The lasagna was the best I‚Äôve ever had. Colton was great and the nice lady made it a very pleasant experience. I‚Äôll be stopping in every time I visit Utah.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Arrington
detailedReviews.text: Excellent food

detailedReviews.author: Deidre Schoenfeld
detailedReviews.text: We were a large party and server was great. I asked if they ever serve Panzanella. Server said chef could put together one even though it wasn‚Äôt on menu.

detailedReviews.author: Pauline Clark
detailedReviews.text: This is a charming restaurant. The service was wonderful and the food out of this world delicious.itbtook me back to my Nona's cooking.

detailedReviews.author: Hannah Clark
detailedReviews.text: My mom and I came here for the first time and we were both injured on knee scooters. We were greeted at the door and the doors opened and offered to sit wherever was comfortable. We have lots of allergies and they were very attentive to helping us have a great meal and great experience by even special making a pizza for us that my mom could eat. Gluten free pasta and pizza were both amazing. Will definitely be coming back here

detailedReviews.author: Amy Shaw
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza around... ok, not many options so let's say it's Absolutely worth the drive from Salt Lake... great vibe and great people!

detailedReviews.author: Mary Goldie Smith
detailedReviews.text: Would recommend to anyone. So good

detailedReviews.author: Diane Shurtleff
detailedReviews.text: Just opened 3 months ago. The service was wonderful very attentive.  The food was sooo good. The atmosphere was very nice and comfortable.  Would highly recomend.

detailedReviews.author: Francisco Mendoza
detailedReviews.text: Good service but no flavor in food. I am not going back.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.3/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the consistently warm and friendly service, which enhances their dining experience. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The restaurant's inviting and cozy atmosphere, complete with Italian music, creates a memorable dining experience that customers love. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The wood-fired pizzas and signature Italian dishes, like veal marsala and lobster ravioli, are frequently praised for their taste and quality. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues - review management can address this concern
Poor online visibility and competition/discovery issues - SEO services can solve this visibility issue
Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Steven Jennings
positive.text: The Absolute best tomato Bisque soup ever ... and the spaghetti sauce is the Absolute best.. most definitely eating there again.. the Wait staff was the best .God Bless Y'alls. Prayers Huggs and Love Always ‚úÖÔ∏è

positive.author: Kimberly Hinkins-Herd
positive.text: This Italian quickly became my favorite. Locally owned by 2 brothers their wood-fired pizzas are amazing, their italian nachos are a masterpiece.

positive.author: Owen Martin
positive.text: This was the best place i‚Äôve ever been! I‚Äôd eat here every single day!

neutral.author: Daniele D'Apuzzo
neutral.text:
Mastra, in American Fork, is the real deal.
Fratelli is not authentic Italian food. Very Americanized. Let me explain why.

- carbonara needs goat cheese, not Parmesan. Which they sell! Also, there is no green peas in carbonara..
- the dirty martini cup came half full, almost half as much as any other place we have been to

The service was great, the waitress was always checking and brought everything on time.

The recipes could use some help ‚Ä¶

neutral.author: Patrick Utley
neutral.text: Meh, it was fine. Nothing special though. Had the Carbonara, and tried the bruschetta appetizer and charcuterie board. Would offer the charcuterie again, but not the other items.

negative.author: Joyce Steverson
negative.text: Way overpriced for amount and taste.   Not worth it.

negative.author: Joe Peterson
negative.text: Very mediocre, bland, overpriced Italian food. Tomato basil soup was the only redeeming quality.

negative.author: Rosie Santiago
negative.text: I got the clam linguine. It was very salty not flavorful at all.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
